Description: Rim and handle fragment of a pottery rosette bowl; interior glazed with worn added colour bands; exterior: black band at lip, black on handle and black line below handle zone, in which a dot rosette is preserved.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 227, no. 137)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 116, pl. XXXVI, no. 327.4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GK.68)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5949 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
